intro: Borreria domingensis, commonly known as the Mexican broom, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Borreria domingensis is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
